isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and disassembled in the same manner.

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the front of each countershaft ( Figure 121).

figure.caption: Figure 121. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use the rear face of the 4th speed gear as a base and press the drive gear, PTO gear, and 3rd speed (or overdrive) gear from each countershaft (left, Figure 122). This removes the front bearing inner race from the countershafts of models so equipped (right).

figure.caption: Figure 122. Press Drive Gear, PTO Gear, and 3rd Speed Gear From Each Countershaft

caution.para: NEVER USE THE PTO GEAR AS A PRESSING BASE. The narrow face width of this gear makes it very susceptible to breakage.

figure.caption: Figure 123. Press 3rd and 2nd Speed Gears From Each Countershaft

note.para: Always use caution when pressing a cluster of gears from the countershaft. It is necessary to press these gears off in a cluster of three and, then, in a cluster of two.

step1.para: If necessary, remove the keys and roll pin from the countershaft ( Figure 124).

figure.caption: Figure 124. Remove Keys and Roll Pin From Countershaft
